Detailed Description

APOXI interface to FM Radio device.

Class RadioAudioDevice provides an interface for the FM Radio device. It supports all functions needed to operate the FM Radio.

ATTENTION: Be aware that no other sound can be heard if the FM Radio device is enabled. As a consequence, the FM Radio device has to be disabled first, before any other sound can be played.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::Disable (   )  [virtual]
 

Disable FM Radio (turn off).

Bring the FM Radio device from Started to Idle mode. This powers down the FM Radio device and reads the current settings from the FM Radio device into RAM. The settings are lost if the mobile station is turned off. When the device is disabled, a AudioDeviceStatusMsg is sent to all applications to inform them, that the FM radio has been disabled.

Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

Implements SimpleAudioDevice.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::Enable (  BOOLEAN  suspend_all_others = FALSE  )  [virtual]
 

Enable FM Radio (turn it on).

Sets the FM Radio device from Idle to Started mode. This powers up the FM Radio device and configures it using the settings given previously by the configuration methods or read from non-volatile memory at last init. When the device is enabled, a AudioDeviceStatusMsg is sent to all applications to inform them, that the FM radio has been enabled.

Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

Implements SimpleAudioDevice.

RadioAudioDevice::BandLimits RadioAudioDevice::GetBandLimits (   )  const
 

Get current radio reception band limits.

This function returns the current band limits the stations are searched. They are defined by legal authorities. Currently band limits for Europe/US and Japan can be used.

Returns:
Current band limits used.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::GetChannelMuteState (  RadioAudioDevice::AudioChannel  channel = RadioAudioDevice::AudioChannelBoth  )  const
 

Get mute state of a channel.

Determine if a channel is currently muted. If "Both" is given as the channel parameter, it will only return TRUE if both channels are muted.

Parameters:
channel Channel to get mute state of.
Returns:
TRUE if selected channel is muted, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::GetStationInfo (  RadioAudioDevice::StationInfo &  info  ) 
 

Get current station information.

This method queries the FM radio driver for information about the currently tuned station. This information consists of several fields, like sender name, sender type, frequency, signal quality and stereo mode.

This method does an active wait for receiving the result of the query.

Parameters:
info Buffer for station info
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

RadioAudioDevice::StereoMode RadioAudioDevice::GetStereoMode (   )  const
 

Get current stereo mode.

This function returns the current stereo mode the FM radio is set to.

Returns:
the current Stereo mode set

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SeekStation (  RadioAudioDevice::SeekDirection  direction,
RadioAudioDevice::SeekMode  mode
) 
 

Seek station.

This function is used to seek to another radio station. Depending on the given direction, it is seeked upwards or downwards starting at the current frequency until a station is found or the frequency band limits are reached.

If the seek mode is set to Manual, the frequency is shifted 0.1 MHz into the given direction.

After the tuning was performed, a "RadioAudioDeviceNotifcation" message is sent.

If the seek mode was set to Auto, the type of the message indicates if a station was found (type = "NotificationTypeStationFound") or the band limits have been reached (type = "NotificationTypeBandLimitsReached").

If the seek mode was set to Manual, the "RadioAudioDeviceNotifcation" message will always have the type set to "NotificationTypeBandLimitsReached", just to inform that tuning is finished.

After the seek the method GetStationInfo should be used to query the current station information.

Parameters:
direction Seek direction (up or down).
mode Seek mode (auto or manual).
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SelectMuteChannel (  RadioAudioDevice::AudioChannel  channel = RadioAudioDevice::AudioChannelBoth  ) 
 

Select the channel to mute.

This function selects the channel which gets muted/unmuted on an upcoming mute call (method SetMute()).

By default the both audio channels are selected.

Parameters:
channel Channel which shall be selected.
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SetBandLimits (  RadioAudioDevice::BandLimits  limits  ) 
 

Set radio reception band limits .

This function sets the band limits used for FM radio reception. The band limits give the frequency range in which stations are searched. They are defined by legal authorities. Currently they can be set for Europe/US and Japan.

The European/US FM band goes from 87,50 to 108,00 MHz, the Japanese FM band from 76,00 to 91,00 Mhz.

Be aware that changing the band limits results in an loss of the current tuned station, because the currently tuned frequency is set to the lower end of the selected band limit.

If FM radio is not enabled when calling this method, the band limits configuration is stored and sent to the FM Radio chip on enable.

Parameters:
band Band limits to set (European-US or Japan)
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SetHighCutControl (  BOOLEAN  hcc_on = TRUE  ) 
 

Set High Cut Control (HCC) state.

This function sets the High Cut Control of the FM radio.

If FM radio is not enabled when calling this method, the high cut control configuration is stored and sent to the FM Radio chip on enable.

Parameters:
hcc_on TRUE, if HCC should be turned on.
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SetHighLowSideLoInjection (  BOOLEAN  high = TRUE  ) 
 

Set High/Low Side LO Injection.

This function sets the High/Low Side LO Injection of the FM radio.

If FM radio is not enabled when calling this method, the High/Low Side LO Injection configuration is stored and sent to the FM Radio chip on enable.

Parameters:
high If TRUE, High Side LO Injection is set, if FALSE, Low Side LO Injection is set.
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SetMute (  BOOLEAN  enable = TRUE,
MuteDirection  direction = UpDownlinkDirection
)  [virtual]
 

Mute selected channels.

This function can be used to mute or unmute the selected channels (the left, the right or both channels). For instance it is quite useful muting both channels to turn of the noise during a station seek. Be aware, that if you mute the right channel using this function and with another invocation the left channel, both channels are muted.

If one channel is muted, the current station is received in mono.

If FM radio is not enabled when calling this method, the mute configuration is stored and sent to the FM Radio chip on enable.

Note: Use SelectMuteChannel() to select the channel to mute.

Parameters:
enable TRUE enables mute, FALSE disables mute. direction This parameter is ignored in case of RadioAudioDevice.
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SetSearchStopLevel (  RadioAudioDevice::SearchStopLevel  level  ) 
 

Set search stop level used for seeking.

This function sets the search stop level of the FM radio.

If FM radio is not enabled when calling this method, the search stop level configuration is stored and sent to the FM Radio chip on enable.

Parameters:
level Search stop level to set (low/mid/high).
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SetStation (  UINT32  frequency  ) 
 

Set station.

Tunes the FM radio to the given station frequency. The frequency has to be given in kHz, e.g. 104.00 MHz -> frequency = 104000

After the tuning was performed, a "RadioAudioDeviceNotifcation" message with the type set to "NotificationTypeBandLimitsReached" is sent, just to inform the application that the tuning is finished.

After that the method GetStationInfo can be used to query the current station information.

Parameters:
frequency Station's frequency in kHz.
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN RadioAudioDevice::SetStereoMode (  RadioAudioDevice::StereoMode  mode = RadioAudioDevice::ModeStereo  ) 
 

Set stereo mode.

This function controls if a station is received in stereo (if possible) or if the FM radio is forced to mono.

If FM radio is not enabled when calling this method, the stereo mode configuration is stored and sent to the FM Radio chip on enable.

Parameters:
mode Stereo mode to be set
Returns:
TRUE if succesful, FALSE otherwise.
